author: Special Correspondent
text:
A three-day home loan mela, organised by the Confederation of Real Estate Developers Association of India (CREDAI), began here on Saturday.

The mela (February 6 to 8), which is being conducted at Vijaya Mahal on Thyagaraya Road in T. Nagar, will be followed by Fairpro 2016, which is scheduled to be held from February 19 to 21 at the Chennai Trade Centre.

Nine banks, including SBI, LICHF, ICICI, AXIS, Sundaram Paribas, KVB, HDFC, TATA Capital and Aditya Birla HSG Finance, are participating with innovative offers to attract buyers.

“After every disaster, home loan offtake usually drops, only to rise in a few months. As the State government and civic bodies such as Chennai Corporation are implementing flood-mitigation projects, residents are expected to take a decision now,” said T.A. Jaishanker, Joint General Manager and Head, Business Development Chennai, HDFC.

Social obligation

“We have planned to continue to give home loans focussing on our social obligation as the largest public sector bank. Home buyers in Chennai will certainly benefit from our path-breaking offers,” said M.S. Dayanand, Chief Manager, Home Loan Sales Team, Guindy, State Bank of India.

“The loan mela is a great platform to create more potential for real estate investors,” said CREDAI Chennaipresident Ajit Kumar Chordia, who inaugurated the mela.

Prospective home buyers can walk in, get their loan eligibility assessed with any of the bankers and walk out with a loan sanction letter.. Last year, bankers at the mela transacted business estimated at Rs.110 crore.
title: Home loan mela by CREDAI begins
